description:
Candidatus Pantoea symbiotica is a bacterial species that exists in a symbiotic relationship with certain insects, particularly aphids. It is an uncultured and uncultivable bacterium, meaning that it has not been successfully grown in a laboratory setting.

Candidatus Pantoea symbiotica is a member of the Enterobacteriaceae family and is closely related to the genus Pantoea, which includes several plant-associated bacteria. This symbiotic bacterium resides within specialized cells called bacteriocytes within the body of its insect host, where it provides essential nutrients and metabolic functions that benefit the aphid.

The genome of Candidatus Pantoea symbiotica is reduced compared to its free-living relatives, indicating a high degree of specialization and adaptation to the intracellular lifestyle within the aphid host. It is believed to play a crucial role in the aphid's nutrition, particularly in the synthesis of essential amino acids that the insect is unable to produce on its own.

This symbiotic relationship between Candidatus Pantoea symbiotica and its aphid host is an example of a mutually beneficial interaction, where both organisms derive benefits from the association, contributing to the overall fitness and survival of the aphid population.
prompt: Provide a short scientific description of this species: Candidatus Pantoea symbiotica
